qmt.geometry.freecad package¶

Submodules¶

qmt.geometry.freecad.auxiliary module¶

General FreeCAD helper functions.

qmt.geometry.freecad.auxiliary.delete(obj)[source]¶

Delete an object by FreeCAD name.

qmt.geometry.freecad.auxiliary.deepRemove(obj=None, name=None, label=None)[source]¶

Remove a targeted object and recursively delete all its sub-objects.

qmt.geometry.freecad.auxiliary.make_objects_visible(zipfname)[source]¶

Make objects visible in a fcstd file with GuiDocument.xml.

qmt.geometry.freecad.fileIO module¶

Functions that deal with file i/o.

qmt.geometry.freecad.fileIO.exportMeshed(obj, fileName)[source]¶

Export a mesh of an object to the given file name.

qmt.geometry.freecad.fileIO.exportCAD(obj_list, file_name)[source]¶

Export a STEP (Standard for the Exchange of Product Data) 3D CAD file.

Parameters:
  • obj_list (list) – List of objects to export.
  • file_name (string) – Name of file to create and export into.
qmt.geometry.freecad.fileIO.updateParams(doc, paramDict)[source]¶

Update the parameters in the modelParams spreadsheet to reflect the current value in the dict.

qmt.geometry.freecad.fileIO.store_serial(target_dict, target_label, save_fct, ext, obj)[source]¶

Store a serialised representation of save_fct(obj, temporary_file.ext) inside target_dict[target_label].

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils module¶

Utilities to work with general geometries.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.extrude_partwb(sketch, length, reverse=False, name=None)[source]¶

Extrude via Part workbench.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.extrude(sketch, length, reverse=False, name=None)[source]¶

Selector for extrude method.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.copy_move(obj, moveVec=(0.0, 0.0, 0.0), copy=True)[source]¶

Create a duplciate of the object using a draft move operation.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.makeHexFace(sketch, zBottom, width)[source]¶

Given a sketch for a wire, make the first face. Also need to make sure it is placed normal to the initial line segment in the sketch. This will ensure that the wire and shell can be constructed with sweep operations.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.genUnion(objList, consumeInputs=False)[source]¶

Generates a Union non-destructively.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.getBB(obj)[source]¶

Get the bounding box coords of an object.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.makeBB(BB)[source]¶

Make a bounding box given BB tuple.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.subtract(obj0, obj1, consumeInputs=False)[source]¶

Subtract two objects, optionally deleting the input objects.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.subtractParts(domainObj, partList)[source]¶

Subtract given part objects from a domain.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.intersect(objList, consumeInputs=False)[source]¶

Intersect a list of objects, optionally deleting the input objects.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.checkOverlap(objList)[source]¶

Checks if a list of objects, when intersected, contains a finite volume.abs Returns true if it does, returns false if the intersection is empty.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.isNonempty(obj)[source]¶

Checks if an object is nonempty (returns True) or empty (returns False).

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.extrudeBetween(sketch, zMin, zMax, name=None)[source]¶

Non-destructively extrude a sketch between zMin and zMax.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.liftObject(obj, d, consumeInputs=False)[source]¶

Create a new solid by lifting an object by a distance d along z, filling in the space swept out.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.centerObjects(objsList)[source]¶

Move all the objects in the list in the x-y plane so that they are centered about the origin.

qmt.geometry.freecad.geomUtils.crossSection(obj, axis=(1.0, 0.0, 0.0), d=1.0, name=None)[source]¶

Return cross section of object along axis.

Build a wire shell part.

qmt.geometry.freecad.objectConstruction.build_lithography(part)[source]¶

Build a lithography part.

qmt.geometry.freecad.objectConstruction.buildWire(sketch, zBottom, width, faceOverride=None, offset=0.0)[source]¶

Given a line segment, build a nanowire of given cross-sectional width with a bottom location at zBottom. Offset produces an offset with a specified offset.

qmt.geometry.freecad.objectConstruction.buildAlShell(sketch, zBottom, width, verts, thickness, depoZone=None, etchZone=None, offset=0.0)[source]¶

Builds a shell on a nanowire parameterized by sketch, zBottom, and width.

Here, verts describes the vertices that are covered, and thickness describes the thickness of the shell. depoZone, if given, is extruded and intersected with the shell (for an etch). Note that offset here is not a real offset - for simplicity we keep this a thin shell that lies cleanly on top of the bigger wire offset. There’s no need to include the bottom portion since that’s already taken up by the wire.

qmt.geometry.freecad.objectConstruction.makeSAG(sketch, zBot, zMid, zTop, tIn, tOut, offset=0.0)[source]¶

qmt.geometry.freecad.run module¶

Landing script for Python 2.7 calls to FreeCAD.

qmt.geometry.freecad.run.main()[source]¶

Fetch input data and dispatch instructions.

WARNING: you must use send_back() to return data to the parent process.

qmt.geometry.freecad.run.activate_doc_from(opts)[source]¶

Activate a valid FreeCAD document from options.

Parameters:opts (dict) – QMT Geometry3D opts dict.
Returns:A FCStd doc loaded from the file_path or serialised document.
qmt.geometry.freecad.run.send_back(data)[source]¶

Go away.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils module¶

Sketch manipulation.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.findSegments(sketch)[source]¶

Return the line segments in a sketch as a numpy array. Note: in FC0.17 sketches contain wires by default.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.nextSegment(lineSegments, segIndex, tol=1e-08, fixOrder=True)[source]¶

Return the next line segment index in a collection of tuples defining several cycles. WARNING: this will by default fixOrder, i.e. side effects on the caller.

Args:
lineSegments: ndarray with [lineSegmentIndex,start/end point,coordinate] segIndex: the index to consider tol: repair tolerance for matching fixOrder: whether the order lineSegments should be repaired on the fly
qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.findCycle(lineSegments, startingIndex, availSegIDs)[source]¶

Find a cycle in a collection of line segments given a starting index. Return the list of indices in the cycle.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.addCycleSketch(name, doc, cycleSegIndList, lineSegments)[source]¶

Add a sketch of a cycle to a FC document.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.addCycleSketch2(name, wire)[source]¶

Add a sketch of a cycle (closed wire) to a FC document.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.addPolyLineSketch(name, doc, segmentOrder, lineSegments)[source]¶

Add a sketch given segment order and line segments

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.findEdgeCycles(sketch)[source]¶

Find the list of edges in a sketch and separate them into cycles.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.findEdgeCycles2(sketch)[source]¶

Find the list of edges in a sketch and separate them into cycles.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.splitSketch_old(sketch)[source]¶

Splits a sketch into several, returning a list of names of the new sketches.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.splitSketch(sketch)[source]¶

Splits a sketch into several, returning a list of names of the new sketches.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.extendSketch(sketch, d)[source]¶

For a disconnected polyline, extends the last points of the sketch by a distance d.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.makeIntoSketch(inputObj, sketchName=None)[source]¶

Turn a 2D generic object like a polyline into a sketch.

qmt.geometry.freecad.sketchUtils.draftOffset(inputSketch, t)[source]¶

Attempt to offset the draft figure by a thickness t. Positive t is an inflation, while negative t is a deflation.

Module contents¶

FreeCAD routines running in a Python 2.7 environment.
